TF022942-GEF2:PDF C-MOROCCO :
            PREPARATION OF THE SOLAR BASED THERMAL PLANT PROJE

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Integrated
            Solar Combined Cycle Power Project in Morocco is to add
            urgently needed capacity to the Moroccan power grid to help
            cope with the sustained growth in electricity demand, to
            increase the contribution of renewable energy sources in
            Morocco's energy mix which would reduce greenhouse gas
            emissions, and to contribute to a program of global
            environmental significance. The project includes the
            integration of a parabolic trough solar field with a
            traditional natural gas based power generating unit
            (combined cycle). The project involves the construction and
            operation of a solar/fossil hybrid power station of about
            472 MW, of which 452 MW2 from combined cycle gas turbine and
            20 MW from the solar component with an expected annual net
            production of 3,538 GWh per year. The solar output is
            estimated at 1.13 percent of the annual production
            representing 40 GWh per year. The project has nine basic
            components: design, construction and operation of an
            integrated solar combined cycle power plant; construction of
            transmission lines; construction of a substation;
            construction of access roads; drilling of boreholes; land
            acquisition; gas pipeline construction; environmental and
            social development management; and consulting services.
